lines:
August 30, 1910.

Mr. S. S. Kwan,

3 Jarvis Hall, Trinity College,

Hartford, Conn.

My dear Kwan,

Your letter of August 18 th was forwarded to me and reached me

as I was leaving camp to return to Andover, consequently I am answering it 
hors, and an enclosing you a check for $50. as requested. P12869 sign and 
return the accompanying receipt.

It is indeed good news to learn that your father is so soon to

visit Agrice,

I shall look forward with the deepest pleasure to meeting

his, for I have formed a very high opinion of his character.

Wishing you the best kind of a time at the Conference, and with

kind membranes to all inquiring friends among your number, believe me,

Most sincerely yours,

Encs.

Principal,
raw: August 30, 1910.  Mr. S. S. Kwan,  3 Jarvis Hall, Trinity College,  Hartford, Conn. P12869 sign and  return the accompanying receipt.  It is indeed good news to learn that your father is so soon to  visit Agrice,  I shall look forward with the deepest pleasure to meeting  his, for I have formed a very high opinion of his character.  Wishing you the best kind of a time at the Conference, and with  kind membranes to all inquiring friends among your number, believe me,  Most sincerely yours,  Encs.  Principal,

metadata.name: Phillips Academy
metadata.abstract: Letter enclosing the $50 requested. Stearns says that he is eager to meet Kwan's father and sends good wishes to him and his friends for the conference.
metadata.collection: Head of School (Stearns) correspondence with Chinese alumni
